description:
His collaboration with the Macedonian Philharmonics showcases a repertoire
inspired by global travels, drawing from classical, flamenco, Afro-Latin, and
Oriental traditions. This musical journey reflects the vibrant tapestry of
Parisian life, blending written scores with improvisation to create a seamless
fusion of styles.
name: Renaud Garcia Fons

performer.description: Renaud Garcia-Fons has redefined the role of the double bass, infusing it with a universal vision that blends technical mastery and lyrical depth. His distinctive sound has become instantly recognizable, merging classical and jazz origins with influences from world music. Passionate about composition, Garcia-Fons collaborates with diverse ensembles and ventures into film music.
performer.name: Renaud Garcia Fons

description:
Initially, Barraud composed most of the material on his first instrument, the
guitar, before expanding on flute, which shows the prominence of his British
guitarist Tam de Villiers. The fleet-footed rhythm section comprises bassist
Guillaume Ruelland and drummer Maxime Zampieri. This is contemporary jazz
brewed with progressive rock, pop and Indian music.
name: Guillaume Barraud Quartet

performer.description: After the acclaimed 'Indo-Jazz Sessions', the Guillaume Barraud Quartet returns with a new opus entitled 'Tales of the Bamboo Reed', exploring the sound of the bansuri with hard-edged electric guitar and moody, groovy bass and drums. A selection of highly poetic pieces that tell a complex initiatic journey, reflecting the artist’s special bond with the Indian bamboo flute. In a blitz of serpentine melodies set against odd-time grooves, the French flautist makes a punchy pitch for the instrument’s versatility.
performer.name: Guillaume Barraud

description:
He's been honored with the Louis Armstrong and Albin Hagstrom Scholarships and
even has his own signature guitar model with AJL-Guitars. As a prolific
composer and producer, he has produced over 35 albums, solidifying his impact
on jazz and beyond.
name: Gustav Lundgren Trio

performer.description: Gustav Lundgren, one of Europe’s leading jazz guitarists, began his global music journey at 19 and has since played in over 27 countries. With a repertoire of more than 800 songs and 100 million streams, his work has drawn praise from legends like John Scofield and George Benson. Gustav’s collaborations include artists such as Jorge Rossy, Chris Cheek, and The Swedish House Mafia.
performer.name: Gustav Lundgren

description:
Kalima has collaborated with legends like Jason Moran and Anthony Braxton. His
accolades include the New German Jazz Prize (2008) and Finland's Jazz-Emma.
Together, the trio delivers a captivating fusion of styles.
name: Kalle Kalima Trio

performer.description: Kalle Kalima, Oli Potratz and Christian Marien form a dynamic trio that blends country, jazz, and blues. Kalima’s albums, High Noon and a jazz/blues project with Knut Reiersrud and Jim Black, inspire their repertoire, showcasing playful and imaginative arrangements. Influenced by Frankie Laine, Marty Robbins, and Sibelius, the trio uniquely merges American country and Finnish classical elements.
performer.name: Kalle Kalima
